title: Downloaded files go to the wrong folder.  A bug ?
content: I selected the setting "Always ask you where to save files". However, when I download files, Firefox automatically dumped the files into the Windows Temp folder. It never asked me where to save the files. I think this is a bug in this most recent version of Firefox (It used to ask me where to save the files in previous versions.) I suggest the Firefox team to correct this issue. It may seem a minor inconvenience, but it is distracting as I have to try to "dig out" the downloaded file among the sea of files in the Windows Temp folder.
creator: for2b2c

title: Firefox struggling to load website partially or completely
content:
I have been having issues for multiple weeks now and I am at a point where I am considering switching to a different browser completely.

My issues are very random and I haven't been able to find a link between the problems. Firefox works fine for some websites, loading them quickly and loading everything on the website, but for other websites it just doesn't. Some websites will only partially load, mainly pictures/thumbnails and comments being the problem, sometimes the problem is fixed when I reload, but it usually persists. Youtube is a website that very clearly shows my problem, I have added 2 screenshots of that. Sometimes Firefox just flat out refuses to load anything in a tab, which is only fixed if I open a new tab and try there, or wait insanely long.

I have tried loading websites in different browser, never running into the same problems there. My internet is also not bad enough to have problems loading. I have tried deleting cookies and cache, turning tracking protection on or off, making a new Firefox profile, starting in safe mode, refreshing firefox and reinstalling firefox, but none have solved the issues.

I hope somebody can help!
creator: aidensmid.t

title: video playback
content: I have developed a Wordpress website with custom javascript written so that selecting a thumbnail image and then clicking on a button that says "Play Videos" will begin playback. If multiple thumbnail images are selected then a playlist is created and the videos will playback sequentially in the order selected. In Firefox, after playback of the video corresponding to first thumbnail image selected, the video player (JWPlayer) shows a message "Video can't play because the file is corrupt". However, clicking again on the "PlayVideos" button will begin playback of the second video and so on. The sequential playback of the playlist functions properly in Chrome, Safari, and MSEdge. In an effort to resolve this issue, I did check the autoplay function in Preferences and it is set to allow both video and audio but did not solve the problem. I would very much appreciate any suggestions as to how to resolve this issue.
creator: fshill

title: Making a download statusbar like Chrome
content: It seems that there isn't an add on out there for Firefox that mimics the download status bar like in Chrome-based browsers. Not one of them are able to open files from the status bar. All of them open a window for what ever reason. Is it because bad coding on the add on dev part, or is this a limitation of Firefox itself. If it is the former, where can I start and work backwards to make one myself. If it is the later, will this ever be a feature?

title: Partial session restoration
content:
I had 2 windows open one with 4 tabs and the other had one tab. My computer was nearly unresponsive (the mouse was leaving a trail of little white turds) and so I shut it down knowing that Firefox would restore my session. Apparently when there are two windows open only one is restored. In this case it was the window with one tab.

Is this considered a feature, an area for improvement, or a don't care?

As several of the tabs needed were not listed in recently closed , I can slog through yesterday's history to find them but I hope this can be addressed.

Thanx, John

creator: suelowery

title: first entry to right click menu is no longer "copy image"
content:
I recently updated Firefox to the new version and found that "copy image" is no longer the first entry to the context menu when I right click on an image I opened in a tab. This is a huge nightmare to me since I save hundrets of images every day and this makes it very difficult for me to do so.

To understand why it is such a big issue to me, I will explain how I save images: My process works by opening tabs I want to save in the same folder, copying the image via the right click menu and pasting them into ms paint. Once I have 20 instances of paint, I save one to set the path. I then close all the others at once allowing me to save them as png by only pressing enter and a number for a name. This way I save 15 images per minute. My problem is after 7 years of saving images this way I keep pressing the (now) wrong button. This may seem like a small problem, but remember this adds up fast when dealing with a lot of files. "Save image as" is inferior in every single way: It does not allow me to save multiple images at once, it uses jpg by standard and I have to write the .png manually.

title: issue with BITS when firefox is in foreground
content:
Hi,

i have observed the following issue.

When i start BIT Transfer with Powershell and then opening Firefox or putting firefox in foreground the BITS transfer stops.

How to reproduce: open windows Taskmanager to observe network load open Powershell execute a BITS Transfer e.g.: 

Start-BitsTransfer -Source http://ipv4.download.thinkbroadband.com:8080/1GB.zip -Destination C:\temp -Asynchronous

Now in Taskmanager there should be some network load visible

Now open Firefox or put firefox in foreground-> BITS transfer stops working Putting firefox in background-->bits transfer continous


I don't know why this could happen or how to further analyse this problem. Is this maybe due to any setting in firefox(i already disabled all plugins and add ons)

Any ideas?

BR Thomas

title: Images double-pasting when composing gmail message
content:
Starting on Sunday 3/21, pasting an image into a gmail message in Windows 10 from Firefox 86.0.1 double pastes it. Two images, not one. Pasting text results in a single paste, as would be expected. What's wrong with image pasting?

Appears to only happen in Firefox. Tried with Edge and composition worked fine.

I found that high-lighting an Image -- (NOTE: "jpg" -- ====> NOT ".png") and then COPY, followed by a PASTE into Gmail produces the correct ONE image.-

However, if the Image is ".png", and I move cursor OVER the Image, then Right-Click, select COPY Image and then go to Gmail and issue either a CTRL+V or PASTE, I get 2 images.

https://support.google.com/mail/thread/103422010

title: Firefox fails to use some local fonts
content:
After installing the Native MathML extension (to get MathML typeset equations on the Wikipedia, as suggested on mediawiki.org), all equations set by MathJax/MathML turned to using STIX instead of Latin Modern. I'd like them to stick to Latin Modern instead.

The only possibly related setting I've found is `font.name-list.serif.x-math` in about:config, whose value is `Latin Modern Math, STIX Two Math, […]`. I tried to manually change the font family specification of some text to see if Firefox could use Latin Modern Math to begin with, but apparently it can't (see first screenshot attached), while it loads STIX allright (second screenshot). Latin Modern is not the first locally installed typeface I haven't been able to use, but it's the first one I have really tried to (I don't remember which one the other typeface was).

My Latin Modern font comes from TeX Live 2019 installed using the TUG installer, not Fedora's package manager. `fc-list | grep -i "latin modern math"` returns `/usr/local/texlive/2019/texmf-dist/fonts/opentype/public/lm-math/latinmodern-math.otf: Latin Modern Math:style=Regular`. I'm running Firefox 87 on Fedora 33.
creator: Fulan

title: Firefox fails to recognize my GPU's but other programs and browsers recognize it.
content:
Firefox fails to recognize my GPU's and uses my integrated GPU rather than my dedicated GPU. I'm using Kali Linux (usually alike Debian Sid on repository grounds), I'm invoking it using DRI_PRIME=1 environment variable because that's where my Radeon RX560 is but firefox opens with this warning on terminal:

[GFX1-]: More than 1 GPU from same vendor detected via PCI, cannot deduce device.

I've even tried nightly but it doesn't recognize the dedicated GPU either, my other GPU is a Radeon Vega 8. All other other programs on the system and even Chrome recognize my RX560. Using DRI_PRIME=4 (that's where my Vega 8 is located) launches the browser with the same warning and again uses the integrated GPU, I know which one is using because radeontop shows memory usage only on the integrated GPU.

I don't know if this isn't the right place to post this, if you know a better place please tell me. Thank you in advance.
creator: samuelms2612

title: Excel Documents from SharePoint freezing in Browser
content: Every excel document I open via Sharepoint on my firefox browser, crashes/freezes, making me unable to work in and I have to force close that tab, as even reloading does not fix the issue. This happens so fast, that when opening an excel via link, I don't even have time to choose the option 'Open in App'. I have already 'cleaned' my firefox, but the issue has not disappeared.

content:
When I go to the web site pluto.tv and click on the lock symbol in the URL I do not see the option to clear cookies & site data. I know this site requires cookies to operate. But I go to another site I see the option to clear cookies & site data, see below.

creator: mace2

title: Bookmark organization upon restoring a .json backup
content:
I made a backup of my current bookmarks as a .json file and then restored an earlier bookmark backup. When I did, all of the bookmarks ended up in the root and all of the folders I made to organize my bookmarks were empty. I didn't really care because I found the bookmark that I was looking for and then restored the new backup that I had made prior to restoring the older one.

Same thing happened, all of my bookmarks ended up in the root and all of my folders were empty again. That's way too much work to have to put them all back in the folders manually and surely it's not designed to work that way.

I did a system restore from several days earlier and that didn't fix it either. I also tried restoring an automatic bookmark, several of them, that didn't work either.

I have the latest version of Firefox installed and it was before I started any of this. I can't find the version number because "About Firefox" only says "Firefox is up to date" under Firefox Browser. Your software below has identified it as version 87.0. Running Windows 8.1.

This is really aggravating, I haven't got time for this crap.
creator: olese

title: Toolbar extensions/add-ons no longer accept touchscreen input
content:
Hello, I've been having this problem when I tap extensions on the toolbar, their small pop-up windows appear in the top-right but when I tap on the buttons in that window, the pop-up disappears instead of accepting my touch input to one of its buttons, it used to accept touch input fine, but no longer does

I've tried refreshing Firefox, and then removing prefs.js in case I messed with any of the about:config settings but it was to no avail, and I've even tried upgrading to Firefox Beta but same problem persists in beta, disabling all the extensions except one still doesn't allow add-ons to accept my touch input.

To be clear, the touch input works on Firefox's inherent buttons in the toolbar, like Bookmarks, History, Downloads, even the Pocket widget and three dots beside it, but any external extensions I install from addons.mozilla site no longer accept the input, and my touch input works fine in Chrome browser, but I like to use both browsers.
creator: jacoalda

title: Firefox Doesn't Work...Profile Crash Again
content: Ok so recently I made a post about the issue of Firefox crashing and having to reinstall it, then kind of fixing it by moving my old profile into this one. Thing is, Firefox crashed on me. Again. And now my profile is yet again, deleted. I tried doing the same thing I did but it didn't work. But there's actually two Firefox folders, one that refuses to leave my desktop (I was actually planning on asking for help on this one) and one that I put in the Application Support place. None of it is working though. It could just be because my computer has some issues though, (it's an old one, 2-4 years old and the sides are a bit damaged because somebody forced it into a tiny box and sent it back and I've also dropped it a few times, although I don't think that would impact it, and also Firefox crashes every so often when I open my bookmarks) this isn't the first time Firefox has crashed, only the first time it crashed and erased my profile. If it helps, I was clicking on my add-ons to get a tomato timer to go (after reinstalling it because some of my add-ons didn't work) and then it crashed, with the twirly rainbow circle. I force quit the app and came back. Voila. If anybody has any help, please do. I have work to do and I don't fancy doing it with this hanging over my head.
creator: amylastlast123

title: Clearing the firefox DNS cache isn't working
content:
Clearing the firefox dns cache isn't working. I went to about:networking clicked DNS then clicked the button to clear the cache then restarted firefox and it didn't work.

My http://localhost website is redirecting to https://localhost even though I turned the redirect off in .htaccess.

title: Firefox Desktop - blurry image under Oculus Link
content:
Hello,

I have Oculus Quest 1 and I am trying to open below VR tour using Oculus Link and latest Firefox Desktop version:

https://show3d.pl/wnetrza/mieszkanie-furtaka1b/?fbclid=IwAR0Y4YKeCSONPCbH522kIUwVEftOzfyn31I0zo2Uce6i5nwCYFtQsamGa5A

Unfortunately, each time when I am clicking on 'Enter VR' button I can see blurry images and broken textures (see the attachments). What is interesting, I have installed also Firefox Reality directly on Oculus and I am experiencing practically the same issue with small difference - before I see these messy interiors an additional notification in terms of... disabling WebXR appears. In both cases I have tried multiple things - changing flags, running desktop Firefox with forced nvidia Control Panel settings (RTX 2060), reinstalling both desktop app and the one in Oculus but with no results... What is even more weird - the presentation above works perfectly fine in Oculus Browser. Do you have any idea what might be the reason of such behaviour? I would be grateful for any clues and possible solutions.

Thank you in advance.

Best regards, Paweł
